alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Ottawa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 2:48AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Delaware and Ottawa Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 247 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Baxter Springs to 3 miles southeast of Fairland. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Baxter Springs... Grove... Fairland... Quapaw... Bernice... Wyandotte... Bernice State Park... Ottawa... Cayuga... Peoria... Twin Bridges State Park... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 298 and 303, and between mile markers 311 and 324. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
